alert.note: Alert for Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:42PM CDT until May 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR WESTERN SHAWNEE AND WABAUNSEE COUNTIES... At 440 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Silver Lake to near Keene to near Alma, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 435 PM, trained spotters reported an estimated wind gust of 60 mph 3 miles north- northwest of Dover. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Topeka, Rossville, Alma, Eskridge, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Maple Hill, McFarland, Paxico, Willard, Keene and Volland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 324 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 169 and 170. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
